tooltip.terraforged.climate.biome_edge_s: Controls the gain subsequent noise octaves
Controls the lacunarity of subsequent noise octaves
Controls the number of noise octaves
Controls the scale of the noise
Controls the strength of the noise
Controls the size of individual biomes
Controls the scale of shape distortion for biomes
Controls the strength of shape distortion for biomes
Macro noise is used to group large areas of biomes into a single type (such as deserts)
tooltip.terraforged.climate.moisture.bia: The bias towards either end of the range
tooltip.terraforged.climate.moisture.fal: How quickly values transition from an extremity
tooltip.terraforged.climate.moisture.max: The upper limit of the range
tooltip.terraforged.climate.moisture.min: The lower limit of the range
tooltip.terraforged.climate.moisture.see: A seed offset used to randomise climate distribution
The bias towards either end of the range
How quickly values transition from an extremity
The upper limit of the range
The lower limit of the range
A seed offset used to randomise climate distribution
tooltip.terraforged.dimensions.bedrock_l: Controls the material that should be used in the world's base layer
Controls the minimum height of the world's base layer
Controls the amount of height randomness of the world's base layer
tooltip.terraforged.dimensions.dimension: Find extra mod-provided dimensions to generate (ie non overworld/nether/end dimensions)
tooltip.terraforged.filters.erosion.depo: Controls how quickly material is deposited (during erosion)
tooltip.terraforged.filters.erosion.drop: Controls the number of iterations that a single water droplet is simulated for
Controls the starting velocity of the simulated water droplet
Controls the starting volume of water that a simulated water droplet carries
The average number of water droplets to simulate per chunk
tooltip.terraforged.filters.erosion.eros: Controls how quickly material dissolves (during erosion)
tooltip.terraforged.filters.smoothing.it: Controls the number of smoothing iterations
tooltip.terraforged.filters.smoothing.sm: Controls how strongly smoothing is applied
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.custom: Use custom biome features in place of vanilla ones (such as trees)
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.erosio: Replace surface materials where erosion has occurred
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.mounta:
The probability that mountainous terrain will be set to a mountain biome type.
This may help improve compatibility with mods that rely exclusively on mountain biomes.
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.natura: Removes snow from the terrain where it shouldn't naturally settle
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.ore_co: Only use stone types that ores can generate in
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.plain_: Changes most exposed rock surfaces to plain stone
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.smooth: Modifies layer block levels (ie snow) to fit the terrain
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.strata: Generates strata (rock layers) instead of just stone
Controls the size of strata regions
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.vanill: Allow vanilla springs (lava source blocks) to generate
Allow vanilla springs (water source blocks) to generate
tooltip.terraforged.miscellaneous.volcan:
The probability that volcano terrain will be set to a volcano biome type.
This may help improve compatibility with mods that rely exclusively on volcano biomes.
tooltip.terraforged.preview.display: Controls the rendering mode on the preview map
tooltip.terraforged.preview.zoom: Controls the zoom level of the preview map
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.branch_rivers: Controls the height of river banks
Controls the height of river banks
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.lakes.chance: Controls the chance of a lake spawning
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.lakes.max_sta: The maximum distance along a river that a lake will spawn
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.lakes.min_sta: The minimum distance along a river that a lake will spawn
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.lakes.size_ma: The maximum size of the lake
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.lakes.size_mi: The minimum size of the lake
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.main_rivers.m: Controls the height of river banks
Controls the height of river banks
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.river_count: Controls the number of main rivers per continent.
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.seed_offset: A seed offset used to randomise river distribution
tooltip.terraforged.rivers.wetlands.size: The maximum size of the wetlands
The minimum size of the wetlands
tooltip.terraforged.structures.seed: A random seed value for the structure.
tooltip.terraforged.structures.separatio:
Controls the minimum distance between instances of the structure.
Larger values guarantee larger distances between structures of the
same type but cause them to generate more 'grid-aligned'.
Lower values will produce a more random distribution but may allow
instances to generate closer together.
tooltip.terraforged.structures.spacing:
Controls the size of the grid used to generate the structure.
Structures will attempt to generate once per grid cell. Larger
spacing values will make the structure appear less frequently.
tooltip.terraforged.structures.stronghol:
Set whether strongholds should only start in valid stronghold biomes. The vanilla behaviour
(false) tries its best to move them to a valid biome but does not prevent generation if there
are no valid biomes nearby. Setting to true outright blocks strongholds from starting in invalid
biomes (note: it doesn't prevent them extending from a valid biome to an invalid one).
Controls the number of strongholds that will generate in the world
Controls how far from spawn strongholds will start generating
A seed offset used to randomise stronghold placement
Controls how spread apart strongholds will generate
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.badlands.bas: Controls the base height of this terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.badlands.hor: Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.badlands.ver: Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.badlands.wei: Controls how common this terrain type is
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.dales.base_s: Controls the base height of this terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.dales.horizo: Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.dales.vertic: Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.dales.weight: Controls how common this terrain type is
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.general.fanc:
Carries out extra processing on mountains to make them look even nicer.
Can be disabled to improve performance slightly.
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.general.glob: Globally controls the horizontal scaling of terrain
Globally controls the vertical scaling of terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.general.terr: Controls the size of terrain regions
A seed offset used to randomise terrain distribution
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.hills.base_s: Controls the base height of this terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.hills.horizo: Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.hills.vertic: Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.hills.weight: Controls how common this terrain type is
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.mountains.ba: Controls the base height of this terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.mountains.ho: Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.mountains.ve: Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.mountains.we: Controls how common this terrain type is
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.plains.base_: Controls the base height of this terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.plains.horiz: Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.plains.verti: Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.plains.weigh: Controls how common this terrain type is
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.plateau.base: Controls the base height of this terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.plateau.hori: Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.plateau.vert: Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.plateau.weig: Controls how common this terrain type is
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.steppe.base_: Controls the base height of this terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.steppe.horiz: Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.steppe.verti: Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.steppe.weigh: Controls how common this terrain type is
Controls the base height of this terrain
Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically
Controls how common this terrain type is
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.volcano.base: Controls the base height of this terrain
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.volcano.hori: Stretches or compresses the terrain horizontally
tooltip.terraforged.terrain.volcano.vert: Stretches or compresses the terrain vertically

tooltip.terraforged.world.continent.cont: Controls how much continent centers are offset from the underlying noise grid.

Controls the size of continents.
You may also need to adjust the transition points to ensure beaches etc still form.

Controls how continent shapes are calculated.
You may also need to adjust the transition points to ensure beaches etc still form.
tooltip.terraforged.world.control_points: Controls how much of the coastal terrain is assigned to beach biomes.

Controls the size of coastal regions and is also the point below
which inland terrain transitions into oceans. Certain biomes such
as Mushroom Fields only generate in coastal areas.

Controls the point above which deep oceans transition into shallow oceans.
The greater the gap to the shallow ocean slider, the more gradual the transition.
Controls the overall transition from ocean to inland terrain.

Controls the point above which shallow oceans transition into coastal terrain.
The greater the gap to the coast slider, the more gradual the transition.
tooltip.terraforged.world.properties.spa: Set whether spawn should be close to x=0,z=0 or the centre of the nearest continent
